properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-11T10:45:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-10T18:45:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3865163004.2021
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A frontal system will approach Vancouver Island tonight. Ahead of the front, southeasterly winds of 70 km/h will develop over exposed coastal sections of East Vancouver Island and Sunshine Coast. Winds will ease Monday morning as the front moves inland. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-11T10:45:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-10T18:46:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1851812036.2021
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Northern Health Authority has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Burns Lake due to high concentrations of fine particulate matter that are expected to persist until tomorrow. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-01-11T04:58:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-01-10T12:59:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3366119813.2021
Area: Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong wind gusts near 90 km/h are anticipated to develop Monday afternoon and diminish in evening. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-11T14:30:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-10T22:31:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4130692159.2021

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A front will approach the BC north coast this evening. Ahead of the front, southeasterly winds of up to 90 km/h will redevelop over exposed coastal sections of Haida Gwaii and the north and central coasts. Winds will ease late this evening over Haida Gwaii and then diminish over the mainland areas of the north and central coasts overnight. On Monday evening, a deep low pressure system will likely bring southeast winds of 90 km/h gusting to 110 to these regions again. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-11T10:42:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-10T18:43:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3062551419.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, Central Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-11T16:56:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-11T00:56:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1707022186.2021

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A frontal system will approach Vancouver Island tonight. Ahead of the front, southeasterly winds of 60 to 90 km/h will develop over exposed coastal sections of West Vancouver Island. Winds will ease Monday morning as the front moves to the east. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. On Monday evening, a deep low pressure system will likely bring southeast winds of 90 km/h again. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur.
